org.pircbotx.hooks

Class WaitForQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pircbotx.hooks.WaitForQueue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class WaitForQueue
extends Object
implements Closeable
    Stores all events in a queue for processing. This is useful for sequential processing of many similar events.

    Example: 

     WaitForQueue queue = new WaitForQueue();
 while(true) {
 MessageEvent mevent = queue.waitFor(MessageEvent.class);
 //Process event
 }
 queue.done();
    Author:
    Leon Blakey

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WaitForQueue(PircBotX bot)
      Create and store a queue listener in the specified bot's ListenerManager.

        public <E extends GenericEvent> E waitFor(@NonNull

      • waitFor

        public <E extends GenericEvent> Event waitFor(@NonNull
                                              List<Class<? extends E>> eventClasses,
                                              long timeout,
                                              @NonNull
                                              TimeUnit unit)
                                       throws InterruptedException
        Wait for events of the specified event class to appear in the queue. If the event was dispatched before this is called, it will return immediately. Events that do not match the specified event class are discarded
        Parameters:
        eventClasses - Events to wait for
        timeout - Timeout value
        unit - Unit of timeout value
        Returns:
        One of the possible events or null if timed out
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • close

        public void close()
        Shuts down the queue; VERY important to call when finished. Since this class stores every dispatched event, failure to close will eventually cause you to run out of memory
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
